;据报道，香港死因裁判法庭去年处理的老年人自杀案件数量创历史新高一个关注团体，呼吁增加医护人员并采取措施让年轻人留在城市，以支持弱势群体。

;

;香港撒玛利亚防止自杀会周六表示，去年有 1,080 人自杀身亡，比 15-15 人高出 10%。年高。约44%，即477人涉及60岁或以上人士，为1973年有记录以来最高。

;

;其中，282人涉及70岁或以上人士，为所有年龄组别中最高的，自杀预防小组执行董事曾展国每年分析死因裁判法庭的统计数据，而60至69岁的人则有195人自杀。

;

;人口增长了，而且这些居民得到的家庭支持也减少了。

;

;“他们的孩子通常在结婚后搬走。此外，现在人们的孩子数量往往较少，因此下一代人的支持不多，”他说。 “当另一半去世，又得不到子女的支持时，孤独感尤其强烈。”

;

;他补充说，70岁或以上的老年居民更容易自杀，因为他们的健康和社交生活恶化最严重。

;

;曾荫权表示，除了敦促有自杀念头的人寻求帮助外，鉴于香港人口老龄化，重要的是要采取措施鼓励年轻人留在城市，以支持弱势群体。

;

; p>;

;香港“隐匿老人”：一连串悲剧可以避免吗？

;

;“香港近年的移民潮也导致家庭抛下年长亲人，增加了他们的孤独感，”曾说。 “政府必须考虑如何让中年人和年轻人留在香港。”

;

;根据官方人口预测，香港65岁及以上的居民将从2019年的20.8%逐渐增加。 2022 年中期到 2028 年增加到 25.3%，然后在 2069 年增加到 35.1%。

;

;Tsang 还敦促当局增加负责为有自杀风险的居民提供支持的医护人员数量。

;

;去年 1,080 起自杀事件中，有 6% 涉及精神障碍患者。该慈善机构呼吁政府加强公众教育，避免对有心理健康问题的人形成刻板印象。

;

;安吉拉*曾被诊断患有抑郁症和双相情感障碍，她敦促有心理健康问题的居民联系寻求帮助。

;

;“如果我们不寻求帮助，很有可能会做出错误的决定，”这名28岁的男子说，他因以下原因在公立医院住了一个月。她两年前患病。 “感到无助会使情况恶化。”

;

;当局周四提议扩大有条件出院计划，将自愿入院的精神病患者纳入其中。

;

;持续的恐惧：为何香港精神病患者出院Kong如履薄冰

;

;Angela表示，需要进行专业评估来确定患者是否可以出院，但长时间留院并不利于患者康复。

;

;“如果他们在医院呆很长一段时间而没有正常的社交生活，他们会感到焦虑和紧张。最终目的是让他们回归社会，过上正常的生活。”她说。

;

;根据拟议的改变，患者自愿入院，但被发现有暴力倾向或表现出攻击性。医院里的行为可能会受到出院时的条件的影响。

;

;专家警告说，这些变化可能会阻止人们寻求帮助，而其他人则建议将该计划扩大到有自杀念头的人。

;

;扩大香港的有条件出院计划“可能会阻止那些寻求帮助的人”

;

;但执行董事曾表示，没有必要将这群患者纳入改革范围，因为他们只有在医生和医生的联合评估后才能出院。社会工作者根据现有规则。

;

;他补充说，那些有严重自杀念头的人不应该出院，因为他们在出院后可能会伤害自己。

;

;在同一广播节目中发表讲话当天，卫生部副部长 Libby Lee Ha-yun 博士表示，政府无意将这些没有表现出暴力行为的患者纳入拟议措施。

;

;“他们得到了社区的支持……我们知道，他们很难寻求医疗帮助。这可能会进一步阻止他们寻求帮助。”Lee 说。

;

;澳大利亚外交部长黄英贤周六表示，维基解密创始人长期被监禁的案件朱利安·阿桑奇已经讲得太久了，需要完成。

;

;阿桑奇是一名被关押在英国的澳大利亚公民，他正在努力争取被引渡到美国，他因泄露机密而被美国通缉。 2010 年美国军事记录和外交电报。

;

;在澳美会议后于布里斯班举行的新闻发布会上，黄表示堪培拉已明确表示“阿桑奇先生的案件拖延了太长时间，我们的愿望”。

;

;澳大利亚敦促美国放弃引渡案，释放维基解密创始人阿桑奇

;

;与国防部长理查德·马尔斯、美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯和国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀·黄表示，已经在公开和私下代表阿桑奇提出了交涉，但在他的法律诉讼结束之前，可以做的事情是有限的。

;

;“我了解阿桑奇先生已提交了一份在英国续签上诉申请。澳大利亚政府不是这些法律程序的当事方，我们也不能干预。”她说。

;

;布林肯证实，阿桑奇的案件已在双边会谈中提出，并表示他理解澳大利亚人对敏感问题的看法。问题。布林肯在新闻发布会上表示：“阿桑奇先生在美国被指控犯有非常严重的犯罪行为，涉嫌参与我国历史上最大规模的机密信息泄露事件之一。” “他所指控的行为可能对我们的国家安全造成非常严重的损害。”

;

;澳大利亚支持在阿桑奇可能被引渡给美国总理安东尼·阿尔巴内塞之前释放阿桑奇。他对持续的拘留感到“沮丧”。

;香港交通运输专员表示，她预计不会在周三，香港的三条海底隧道将大幅改善交通状况，直至今年晚些时候，收费系统将实施更多改革。

;

;“第一阶段的新收费将有所帮助局长罗淑佩周六在电台节目中表示，“但我们需要等待今年晚些时候实施时变隧道收费，才能看到实际的好处。我们需要时间观察司机的偏好是否改变或交通是否被分流。”

;

;从周三开始，香港将缩小三条海底隧道的收费差异，以缓解交通挤塞。< /p>;

;缓解交通拥堵的两阶段安排的第一阶段将把私家车使用西区海底隧道的通行费从 75 港元（9.60 美元）削减至 60 港元，而东区海底隧道和过境隧道的收费则为 60 港元。海底隧道费用将分别由 20 港元和 25 港元增至 30 港元。的士在所有三个过境点均收取 25 港元。

;

;新收费生效后，预计会有更多私家车和的士改道至不太拥堵的西区海底隧道。

;

;但是驾车者团体对修改后的收费泼了一盆冷水，称其不会对改变司机的出行模式或分流香港三条海底隧道的交通产生太大影响。

;

;香港的海底隧道周日采用新的电子收费系统

;

;“西区海底隧道的收费是最贵的，是其他两个繁忙的过路费的两倍。香港汽车联会会长李耀培表示，新收费不会对三个隧道的交通分流产生任何显着改善。

;

;“如果没有任何改善，当局应该建造第四条隧道，或者将所有隧道收费调整到同一水平。”

;

;这些变化将于周三在西部过境点的特许经营协议到期且政府接管隧道运营后生效。

;

; p>;

;作为该计划第二阶段的一部分，当局将在今年年底前对隧道实施按时间调整的收费，以阻止司机在高峰时段使用隧道。

;

;香港海底隧道收费争论已经结束，但会计划缓解拥堵吗？

;

;李认为，司机不会改用更昂贵的西区海底隧道，以避免香港最繁忙的过海隧道出现拥堵。< /p>;

;“在收费调整下，使用海底隧道和东区海底隧道的人士将需要支付更多费用，而使用西线的人士则需要支付较少的费用。这是唯一的影响，不会影响城市海港口岸的交通。

;

;“只有当所有隧道收费变得相同时，才会缓解拥堵，因为司机将有真正的选择”

;

;但香港的士联会副主席吴君星支持新收费，认为部分的士交通将被分流至西线，三个口岸统一收费25港元。

;

;红磡海底隧道收费50港元，香港商用车车主表示不公平

;

;“没有收费不同的是，更多乘客可能愿意使用西线过海，而出租车司机则乐意改用这条隧道返回九龙一侧。” “这是双赢的。出租车司机可以避开另外两个十字路口的拥堵和排长队。”

;

;通勤关注组织公共交通研究小组的发言人 Quentin Cheng Hin-kei 表示，他对新收费是否会影响交通持怀疑态度。缓解路口拥堵。

;

;“我并不乐观。红磡海底隧道及东区海底隧道的交通流量已超过其容量。更多车辆将转移到东部路口，这将加剧其过度拥挤的问题，”他说。

;

;“新措施可能会缓解隧道内的拥堵，但不会缓解通往路口的道路上的拥堵。政府需要改善城市的公共交通服务和网络，以解决拥堵问题。”

;

;如何避免香港过海隧道收费出现新的高峰？

;

;第二阶段，星期一至六早上7.30至10.15及下午4.30至晚上7时的高峰时段，私家车在西区海底隧道收费港币60元，在红磡海底隧道及东区海底隧道收费港币40元隧道。红磡海底隧道的新高峰时段通行费是目前价格的两倍。

;

;所有三条隧道上午 10.15 至下午 4.30 期间收费 30 港元，非高峰时段（晚上 7 点至下午 7 点至下午 7 点）收费 20 港元。次日早上7时30分。

;

;罗补充说，自上周日红磡海底隧道推出电子收费系统HKeToll以来，交通流量每日增加2,000辆，且切道现象减少。

;共和党领跑者唐纳德·特朗普将自己视为该党夺回白宫的最佳人选即使他面临另一项刑事起诉。

;

;“2024 年大选是我们拯救美国的最后一搏，只有一名候选人，而你知道那个候选人是谁，”这位前总统周五在国会表示。得梅因的林肯晚宴是爱荷华州提前投票的共和党人聚会，聚集了 2024 年竞选领域的大部分人士，其中包括他的提名主要竞争对手罗恩·德桑蒂斯。

;

;特朗普是当晚的最后一位发言人，全场起立鼓掌，他在演讲中列举了他任期内取得的成就，包括与墨西哥和加拿大重新谈判贸易协议，以及任命三名最高法院法官，巩固了保守派多数地位，废除了罗伊诉韦德案。

;< p>;特朗普滔滔不绝地公布了一系列民意调查数据，显示他击败了乔·拜登总统，并强调了他在提前投票州的广泛领先优势。

;

;“虽然德桑托斯在所有情况下都输给了拜登，但我不会抓住这个机会，”特朗普说道，并猛烈抨击了他的第二名挑战者。

;

;特朗普发誓，如果罪名成立，他将继续总统竞选

;

;这是特朗普第一次参加晚宴自从州长作为前总统的一个不那么两极分化的替代者参加竞选以来，德桑蒂斯和德桑蒂斯就在爱荷华州的同一地点。

;

;但德桑蒂斯一直在努力削弱特朗普的领先优势，RealClearPolitics 的民调平均值显示他落后34个百分点。德桑蒂斯早些时候在活动中发表讲话，避免提及特朗普，而是吹捧了他作为佛罗里达州州长的记录。

;

;特朗普出席活动正值他竞选的关键时刻，这位前总统正准备迎接另一场大选。起诉书，这次是特别检察官杰克·史密斯对 2020 年大选和 2021 年 1 月 6 日美国国会大厦袭击事件的调查。

;

;“如果我不竞选，就不会有人来了在我之后，”特朗普说，他只是简单地提到了这些案件。

;

;在之前的起诉之后，随着他的狂热支持者和知名共和党人团结起来支持他，他的民意调查和筹款活动激增。但目前尚不清楚更多指控是否会带来类似的势头。

;

;在周五的晚宴上，来自德克萨斯州的前美国众议员威尔·赫德是唯一一位直接批评特朗普的候选人，他敦促共和党人超越这位党内旗手。< /p>;

;“唐纳德·特朗普竞选是为了远离监狱，”赫德在观众的大声嘘声中说道。

;

;特朗普因处理机密文件而在联邦案件中被起诉，并在在纽约州法院，他面临涉嫌向成人电影明星支付封口费的指控。

;

;周四，特朗普在涉及机密文件的刑事案件中受到新的妨碍司法罪指控，其中包括对他和两名雇员的指控试图删除他的海湖庄园的监控录像。

;中国一位诚实的租户在 2017 年发现了价值 40 万元人民币（56,000 美元）的隐藏宝藏她的公寓——并放弃了它，以便可以由其合法主人收回——在大陆社交媒体上赢得了广泛赞誉。

;

;一段展示发现的贵重物品的视频在网上疯传，并让发现该物品的女子变得兴奋起来社工姜静平变身网络英雄。

;

;50岁出头的姜静平在浙江省宁波市镇海区康欣工疗站工作。

;

; p>;

;《宁波晚报》报道，除了照顾残疾人的工作外，姜女士还是一名积极的社区志愿者。

;

;7月20日，在搬进新租住的公寓后不久，姜女士决定进行深度清洁，期间她在柜子后面发现了一个隐藏的保险箱。

;

;“当我移动柜子并拆掉一些壁纸时，我在墙角发现了一个隐藏的小隔间。我很困惑，”姜告诉新闻媒体。

;

;这段病毒视频显示，她发现墙上嵌着一个绿色保险箱，靠近地板。

;

;打开保险箱后，她惊讶地发现，里面藏着一些贵重物品，包括五张定期存单和各种珠宝，包括金戒指和项链。

;

;仅存单面值就达40万元。

;

; p>;

;“我一开始很困惑，因为我以前从未见过这么多值钱的东西，”江说。

;

;她还告诉新闻媒体，她不能保留任何不属于她的东西。并及时联系了该公寓所在的后大街社区工作人员。

;

;社区很快发现该公寓的前业主一对老年夫妇已经去世，他们的孩子已经将房产卖掉了。

;

;现在，社区正在联系老夫妇的家人，他们正在看管贵重物品。

;

;社区党委书记张静波后大街社区表示：“我们很荣幸有一个像姜这样的邻居，我们为她的行为点赞！”

;

;姜的故事赢得了网上观察者的阵阵掌声。

;

;一位人士说：“尽管她需要租房子，但她仍然不肯把贵重物品装进口袋。这位女士和她的家人肯定会受到祝福。”

;

;其他人对这个独特的藏身之处表示惊讶，其中一个人指出：“将保险箱放在柜子后面绝对是出乎意料的。”

;

; Sat, 29 Jul 2023 12:20:02 +0800 ‘Barbenheimer’ craze has Hong Kong film fans dressing up to watch summer blockbusters back-to-backhttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/society/article/3229339/barbenheimer-craze-has-hong-kong-film-fans-dressing-watch-summer-blockbusters-back-back?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.29 12:00;
;;

;Hong Kong movie-goers have leapt headlong into the “Barbenheimer” phenomenon, getting together, dressing up and heading to the cinema for summer's most hyped blockbusters.

;

;The films could not be more different. Greta Gerwig's Barbie is all pink, fluffy fun about the iconic doll, whereas Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer is a serious three-hour epic about the scientist who helped create the atomic bomb.

;

;Call it extreme viral marketing or the impact of social media, but the same-day opening of the two Hollywood films sparked countless memes and led to the word “Barbenheimer” being coined, along with suggestions to watch both one after the other.

;

;Hong Kong cinema operators noted the buzz and early box office takings, but grumbled that the phenomenon was no silver bullet for their industry's slow recovery from the Covid-19 pandemic.

;

;Among those who joined the party in Hong Kong was university student Muhammad Nauman Qureshi, 20, who went with six friends to watch the two films back-to-back after seeing the memes online.

;

;Hong Kong cinema cancels private screening on 'sensitive' June 4, group says

;

;“I thought it was a really fun thing to do,” he said. “You see it everywhere – on Instagram, on YouTube – everyone is advertising this and it is just a funny thing to do.”

;

;The Hong Kong permanent resident and four of his friends took things further by dressing up for the occasion, wearing dark formal outfits for Oppenheimer and pink for Barbie.

;

;“I think it is nice having a once-in-a-while type of thing like 'Barbenheimer', but we do not have to keep doing it,” he said.

;

;Bartender Joshua Collett, 25, and his girlfriend, university student Valerie Yuen, 22, watched both films on opening day, July 20.

;

;Collett, a Singaporean and Hong Kong permanent resident, said although he had seen films back-to-back in the past, it was not something he did often.

;

;“But there was a big hype train around the two giant films coming out in the summertime, two big directors and filmmakers. Overall, we had a really great time,” he said.

;

;Cinema websites shut down amid high demand for tickets during 'Happy Hong Kong' drive

;

;Like others, the couple did not only dress up, but also had a coffee and a cigarette before Oppenheimer, as a nod to the chain-smoking physicist, and relaxed with margarita cocktails before Barbie.

;

;“We made it an experience, instead of just going to see a movie,” Collett said.

;

;Both films proved massively successful overseas according to data provider BoxOfficeMojo, with Barbie earning US$162 million (HK$1.3 billion) in the North American box office over three days from July 21, smashing the previous US$146.3 million opening weekend record for the year held by the The Super Mario Bros. Movie. Oppenheimer raked in US$82.4 million

;

;In Hong Kong, Oppenheimer took HK$18.14 million (US$2.3 million) between July 20 and 25, outdoing Barbie, which earned HK$9.8 million, according to data from the Hong Kong Motion Picture Industry Association (MPIA) and Hong Kong Box Office Limited (HKBO).

;

;Cinema-goers can enjoy new titles, re-runs with 'Happy Hong Kong' ticket discount

;

;Both, however, were eclipsed in earnings by Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One which was released on July 13 and made HK$49.1 million as of July 25.

;

;The Hong Kong Theatres Association, representing 59 out of 63 commercial cinemas in the city, expected the “Barbenheimer” phenomenon to boost ticket sales over the summer, but lamented that it was not enough to help the troubled sector.

;

;Chairman Timothy Yuen Yin-man said the trend, buoyed by good reviews for both films, would encourage people to watch both films.

;

;But it could not fix the industry's “unsatisfactory” recovery following the pandemic.

;

;MPIA and HKBO data showed local box office takings from January 1 to July 25 this year dropped by almost a quarter to HK$922 million from HK$1.226 billion in 2019, which meant only a 75 per cent recovery to pre-pandemic levels.

;

;“For a movie to make tens of millions in the box office, it is already very good, but a marketing effect like 'Barbenheimer' will only help us make around 10 to 20 million more,” he said.

;

;“We are missing HK$304 million in sales, an amount which is absolutely not something that the 'Barbenheimer' effect can bring back.”

;

;The association said there were two factors behind the drop in business even after Hong Kong lifted the last of its pandemic restrictions in March – there were fewer popular films, and the pool of cinema patrons had shrunk with the wave of emigration from the city.

;

;Takeshi Kaneshiro, Hong Kong cinema's 'most good-looking' actor

;

;Ticket sales spiked with the launch of “Cinema Day 2023” in April, part of the government's “Happy Hong Kong” campaign. Cinema patrons bought about 222,036 tickets costing HK$30 each for movies screened on April 29.

;

;Asked if the event should be held again, Yuen said cinemas would be open to the idea, but cautioned that repeated offers could reduce their appeal.

;

;He said the industry would instead focus on other ways to earn income, including sales from concessionary stands, advertisements and venue rentals. They were also exploring the use of cinemas as venues for small-scale performances.

;

;But for the industry to bounce back, what mattered most was the quality of the films.

;

;“If there are no good movies being released, anything you do would be useless, even if tickets are as cheap as HK$20 to HK$30,” he said. “The audience is very smart.”

;;2023.07.29 11:30;
;;

;Even in his absence, Thaksin Shinawatra has remained at the fulcrum of politics in Thailand.

;

;The ex-prime minister fled into self-exile in 2008, spending his time in London, Dubai and Hong Kong, as court cases stacked up against him, two years after a coup toppled his elected government.

;

;But in under two weeks, Thaksin – Thailand's only civilian leader to finish a term and then be re-elected – appears poised to finally return home.

;

;If he does so on August 10 as expected, he will return to a changed country.

;

;Approve Pita as PM or 'get out', Bangkok protesters tell Thai senators

;

;His family's Pheu Thai Party no longer automatically carries the votes of the rural and urban poor. Instead, the more radical Move Forward Party has emerged as the kingdom's dominant pro-democracy force, after the public warmed to its messages on structural reforms and economic and social equality.

;

;Still, Pheu Thai is trying to form a government after election-winning Move Forward was blocked from power.

;

;Experts say Thaksin, aged 74 and facing 10 years in jail, is unlikely to serve much – if any – jail time, speculating that the billionaire who was once the bane of the establishment may have made a “super-deal” to return with his one-time conservative enemies.

;

;That is likely to see Move Forward shunted into opposition, despite winning the May election.

;

;Whatever political machinations lie ahead, Thaksin's presence will add a headline-hogging, unpredictable new dynamic to an already complicated situation.

;

;

;

;After years of false starts, Thaksin's return seems real.

;

;“Dad is coming back on August 10,” Thaksin's youngest daughter, Paetongtarn Shinawatra, said in a social media post this week, giving the firmest confirmation yet to his return.

;

;For his part, Thaksin on Friday tweeted a link to a TikTok video by Thai indie rocker Sek Loso, promising to perform on stage together once he returns.

;

;He is due to land at Bangkok's Don Mueng airport, where a horde of media and political supporters are likely to seek to greet the most significant person in recent Thai political history. The tycoon would be subject to the judicial process upon his return, deputy national police chief Surachate Hakparn said.

;

;“The police will conduct their duties normally when the plane lands. He will have to go to court and listen to what they decide,” Surachate said.

;

;The court is expected to order him to go straight to jail.

;

;Thaksin faces 10 years in prison for three convictions made in absentia, including abuse of power and corruption, which he says were all politically motivated.

;

;He is entitled to seek detention in medical facilities as an elderly inmate, and then can petition for a royal pardon from Thai King Maha Vajiralonkorn, caretaker Deputy Prime Minister Wissanu Krea-ngam said.很少有人预计他信会真正入狱——尤其是与其他囚犯一起服刑的普通民众。 A pardon remains his quickest route from detention.

;

;

;

;Thaksin nostalgia runs deep in the upcountry 'Red Shirt' rural heartlands, where he is adored for his economic policies that for the first time raised rural incomes and addressed the changing aspirations of the poor. Their votes powered him to two election wins in 2001 and then 2005, which rattled the Bangkok establishment.

;

;But he is also reviled by conservatives. Many prominent politicians have spent two decades earning their reputations by vilifying him and his family for toxifying Thai politics and society with corruption and nepotism.

;

;In the hothouse of Thai politics, where grudges, recriminations and violence stalk the scene, there are inevitable security risks for a high-profile, yet divisive, figure.

;

;In her Instagram post, his daughter Paetongtarn, who is assuming the family political mantel at the top of Pheu Thai, conceded to worries over his “safety” but respected her father's decision to come back.

;

;

;

;Move Forward's emergence as the nation's biggest party is the most serious challenge to the conservative establishment since Thaksin's breakout election in 2001.

;

;Experts say Move Forward's calls to de-monopolise the economy and reform the royal defamation law, which shields the monarchy from criticism, are unprecedented and have rattled the 'old powers' of the generals, business elite and palace who hold the tethers on Thai democracy.

;

;Meanwhile, the party's young supporters have little memory of – and even less deference to – Thaksin, or the phalanx of former generals and ageing politicos who head the conservative parties and populate the unelected Senate.

;

;Pheu Thai wanted a landslide of 270-300 lower house seats but were pushed into second place with just 141 seats, losing many of their upcountry vote banks to Move Forward.

;

;The party's diluted power may make it a more palatable partner in a conservative alliance, which then freezes Move Forward into opposition.

;

;Thaksin Shinawatra returning to Thailand from exile on August 10: daughter

;

;Pheu Thai's conundrum is finding a way to break from Move Forward while sustaining as little lasting damage as possible to its pro-democracy brand.

;

;A rumoured “super-deal” in Hong Kong this week between Thaksin, Thanathorn Juangroongruangkit – the founder of the political movement which Move Forward has taken on – as well as Anutin Charnvirakul, who leads the third-placed Bhumjaithai Party, could hold the keys to government.

;

;The deal allegedly allows for Thaksin's return and for Pheu Thai to join a coalition including Bhumjaithai and even the former military-aligned governing party of Phalang Pracharat, while Move Forward would slip into opposition.

;

;Anutin, who has described Thaksin as his mentor, is one of the few remaining prime ministerial candidates who can contest future parliamentary votes for the role – as is Pheu Thai's Srettha Thavisin, a property tycoon, and Thaksin's daughter Paetongtarn.

;

;A joint session of parliament is due to hold another round of voting on August 4, three weeks after Pita Limjaroenrat of Move Forward was blocked by the military-appointed Senate from becoming Thailand's next prime minister. ;

;The video was posted on Douyin by the mother, who is an influencer, known as Little Jasmine of the Dull and Wired Donkey, from Anhui province in southeastern China. She often shares snippets from the daily lives of her two daughters, the older one, nicknamed Little Jasmine, and the younger, Liuliu.

;

;The July 23 video showed her husband and Liuliu in a child's seat savouring barbecue skewers together around midnight.

;

;As Liuliu struggles to take a bite from a skewer with large chunks of meat, her father lends a hand, prompting the caption, “So happy!” to appear.

;

;The father also peels garlic and asks if Liuliu would like some, but she shakes her head in refusal, prompting the caption: “I don't want it.”

;

;The two also enjoyed a playful toast; the father with a beer can and his daughter with a goblet-shaped baby bottle filled with milk.

;

;The caption that followed humorously added: “When Mum leaves, we'll open another bottle.”

;

;This isn't the first time the influencer has garnered significant attention with endearing moments between the father and daughter.

;

;A video shared in June showed the father comforting a crying Liuliu after her mother scolded her and received more than 555,000 likes.

;

;The midnight-toast video has also been highly popular on Chinese social media.

;

;One viewer jokingly said: “Don't tempt me to have another child. I already have three children, all boys.”

;

;Another said: “What should I do? I really want to buy the same goblet-shaped baby bottle but fill it with beer.”

;

;A third person remarked: “A man who can play with his child like this is surely a good husband!”

;

;Chinese fathers are increasingly taking part in child-rearing as outdated traditional values evolve to meet the needs of modern Chinese families.

;
